model.levelsequence.level.grid

Interface Grid

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GridImpl

    public interface Grid
extends java.io.Serializable
    The squared grid in which the elements are.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int N_ROWS
      The number of rows, which is equal to the number of columns.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Element element)
      Adds the given element to the grid.
      void clear()
      Removes all the elements.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Two grids are equal if their elements are the same.
      java.util.List<Element> getAllElements()
      Gets all the elements.
      java.util.List<Element> getBoxesOnTarget()
      Gets all the boxes that are on the same position of a target.
      java.util.List<Element> getElementsAt(Position position)
      Gets all the elements that are currently at the given position.
      int hashCode()
      The grid hash code is computed on grid elements.
      boolean moveAttempt(Element element, MovementDirection direction)
      Moves, if possible, the given element to the adjacent position in the given direction.
      void remove(Element element)
      Removes the given element from the grid.

    • Field Detail

      • N_ROWS

        static final int N_ROWS
        The number of rows, which is equal to the number of columns.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(Element element)
        Adds the given element to the grid. The position information is held by the element itself.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to be added

      • remove

        void remove(Element element)
        Removes the given element from the grid.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to be removed

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all the elements.

      • getAllElements

        java.util.List<Element> getAllElements()
        Gets all the elements.
        Returns:
        all the elements of the grid

      • getBoxesOnTarget

        java.util.List<Element> getBoxesOnTarget()
        Gets all the boxes that are on the same position of a target.
        Returns:
        the list of the boxes which are on target

      • getElementsAt

        java.util.List<Element> getElementsAt(Position position)
        Gets all the elements that are currently at the given position. In a given position there can be at most two elements at a given time (e.g. box over target or user over target). So the returned list can contain 0 to 2 elements.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to search into
        Returns:
        the elements in the given position

      • moveAttempt

        boolean moveAttempt(Element element,
                    MovementDirection direction)
        Moves, if possible, the given element to the adjacent position in the given direction. The only movable elements are users and boxes. Users can move if the target position is empty or if there is a box that can move in the same direction. A box can move only if the target position is empty or a target.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to be moved
        direction - the direction of the movement
        Returns:
        true, if there has been movement

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        The grid hash code is computed on grid elements.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the computed hash-code

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Two grids are equal if their elements are the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to be compared
        Returns:
        true, if successful
